title: Who's on Sky Sports this weekend?
description: Find out who is on Soccer AM, Goals on Sunday, Sunday Supplement and Soccer Saturday this weekend, and our blockbuster live football coverage...
content:
Burnley v Man City
Sky Sports Premier League and Sky Sports Main Event, Saturday, 11.30am
Will Pep Guardiola's runaway Premier League leaders take another step towards the title at Turf Moor this weekend, against a Burnley side struggling for form?
Crystal Palace v Newcastle United
Sky Sports Premier League and Sky Sports Main Event, Super Sunday, 1.30pm
A huge relegation six-pointer at Selhurst Park as in-form Palace entertain out-of-sorts Newcastle, but who will emerge victorious in the capital?
Liverpool v Tottenham Hotspur
Sky Sports Premier League and Sky Sports Main Event, Super Sunday, 4.15pm
Liverpool host rivals Spurs at Anfield in the big Super Sunday offering with the two teams separated by just two points in the standings in the race to secure a top-four finish in this season's Premier League.
Soccer Saturday
Sky Sports News, Saturday, 12pm and Sky Sports Main Event, Premier League and Football, 3.15pm
Jeff Stelling and Co return with Soccer Saturday as they reflect on the big talking points from the week and look ahead to the upcoming 3pm action.
Joining Jeff will be regulars Matt Le Tissier, Paul Merson, Charlie Nicholas and Phil Thompson, who will bring you all the action from up and down the leagues.
Plus, big-name interviews with the likes of Rafa Benitez, Joao Mario, Romelu Lukaku, Ben Chilwell and Chris Brunt.
Sunday Supplement
Sky Sports Premier League and Sky Sports Football, Sunday 9.30am
Discussing all the major talking points in the game with host Neil Ashton this weekend will be Sam Wallace (Chief Football Writer, The Daily Telegraph), John Cross (Chief Football Writer, the Mirror) and Jonathan Liew (Chief Sports Writer, The Independent).
Goals on Sunday
Sky Sports Premier League, Sunday, 11am
Former Swansea City manager Paul Clement will be on the sofa with Ben and Kammy talking through a coaching career that has taken the Englishman to Paris Saint-Germain, Real Madrid and Bayern Munich as Carlo Ancelotti's right-hand man.
Soccer AM
Sky Sports Premier League, Sky Sports Football, Sky One, 10am
Leon McKenzie and Mo Gilligan join Fenners, Jimmy, Lloyd and Co on the sofa, alongside Cici Coleman and Laura Tott from First Dates. You Know the Drill goes to Newport County, and we'll also have their fans in the studio as Fans of the Week.
